prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: how to control my heavy mood swings and short temper

PATIENT: hello doctor I am suffering from heavy mood swings if something is happening against my will I lose my patience and I am not able to tolerate this that phase is very short like for a few minutes but in that short phase I threw something or grumble my teeth or utter bad words to anyone who is in front of me after this stage is gone I am extremely normal and start feeling guilty of my actions I am facing this problem for the last seven to eight years I am becoming very short tempered are there any medicines which can help me to get out of this situation I have tried yoga meditation but nothing helped me please help I am a software engineer with a profession my age is 27 years I am a sole child my dad is no more and my mother and I stay at different places I am a bisexual top I have a girlfriend and a boyfriend too many times I broke with my boyfriend over pitty issues which spoils the entire relationship

DOCTOR: hello I read your query and understand your concerns first of all I must assure you that there are multiple medications which can be used to control anger most of these medications stabilize your brain and help in controlling mood swings after a trivial incident the options include sodium valproate lithium carbonate propranolol topiramate atypical antipsychotics and lot more I need to acknowledge here that there is no universal medication for control of anger and every patient responds differently to each medication before selecting a medicine for an individual it is important to have complete details about the patient regarding the efficacy of medications as per my experience patients report 60 80 reductions with different regiment and report a great improvement over a period of time I hope this helps

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I have a sore throat for more than two weeks even after taking antibiotics why

PATIENT: i have a sore throat for more than weeks now and I am done taking antibiotics dalacin for days but it is not going away I feel that there is something stuck inside my throat esophagus I have a mild headache but no fever pain scale is ranging 6 out of ten I also gargle every hours using difflam gender age 36 it 1 wt 191 labs

DOCTOR: if this got worse after antibiotics it is likely thrush a yeast infection of the throat often found after antibiotic and or steroid treatment see if you can get your physician to prescribe fluconazole 150mg daily 10 days not days like prescribed for female yeast infections this would not be long enough if it got much better after the antibiotic and has stayed level you might consider that whatever bacteria you had was partially resistant and another should be tried a good one to consider if you have not had this yet is clindamycin 450md three times a day 10 days if you have had that already consider amoxicillin clavulinic acid 875mg twice a day 10 days if none of these are the case see an ent to rule out an abscess behind the tonsil know as a peritonsillar abscess or some other cause

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I have a little fever with no history of foreign travel or contact what is the chance of couid 19

PATIENT: hello doctor I am suffering from coughing throat infection from last week at that time fever did not persist and also did not felt any chest pain two days later I consulted with a doctor he prescribed cavidur 625 monte la ambrolite syearup and betadine gargle solution since then throat infection improved and frequent cough also coming out coughing also improved remarkably though not completely from yesterday onwards fever is occurring maximum 100 degree celsius I have not come in touch with any foreign returned person nor went outside in our state there is no incidence of couid 19 please suggest what to do

DOCTOR: hi I can understand your concern in my opinion you should get done a chest ray and abc complete blood count if both these are normal then no need to worry much I hope this helps

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: persistent lower back pain after lifting heavy objects at work

PATIENT: hello doctor I have been experiencing severe lower back pain for about three weeks now it started after I lifted some heavy boxes at my warehouse job the pain is constant around 4-5 out of 10 but when I bend or twist it shoots up to 8 out of 10 I have tried over the counter ibuprofen 400mg three times daily and using heat pads but the relief is only temporary I am a 42 year old male with no previous back issues my job requires frequent lifting and I am worried this might affect my work capacity I have no numbness or tingling in my legs but sometimes feel stiffness in the morning

DOCTOR: hello I understand your concern about persistent back pain after heavy lifting this sounds like a musculoskeletal strain possibly involving the lumbar muscles or ligaments I would recommend first getting an x-ray of your lumbar spine to rule out any structural issues meanwhile you should continue anti-inflammatory medication but consider switching to naproxen 500mg twice daily which may provide longer lasting relief physical therapy would be beneficial focusing on core strengthening exercises and proper lifting techniques avoid heavy lifting for at least 2-3 weeks and use proper form when you resume if the pain persists beyond 4-6 weeks despite these measures we might need to consider an MRI to evaluate for disc involvement

STATUS: medium severity
